sentences.english: The cracks and flaws in Mary's old performance have been skillfully varnished over.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽以往表演中的一些缺点都被巧妙地掩饰过去了。

sentences.english: If Satan can't defeat us by a frontal attack, he will do it in a more subtle way.
sentences.chinese: 撒但若不能正面攻击我们，就会改用更巧妙的诡计。

sentences.english: He skillfully parried the question with a clever reply.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地避开了那个不受欢迎的问题。

sentences.english: He dealed with an embarrassed situation dexterously.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地应付了一个尴尬局面。

sentences.english: By the evening of the 16th the subtle hand of Hurstwood had made itself apparent.
sentences.chinese: 到了16日晚上，赫斯渥已经巧妙地大显神通。

sentences.english: Clever uses of shopping bags in advertising campaigns by various companies.
sentences.chinese: 许多商家巧妙地利用购物袋来推广自己的品牌。

sentences.english: Adding to the complexity of the equation will subtly enlarge the complexity of the resulting image.
sentences.chinese: 增加方程的复杂性将可巧妙地扩大生成图像的复杂性。

sentences.english: He parried the unwelcome question very skilfully.
sentences.chinese: 他很巧妙地避开了那个不受欢迎的问题。

sentences.english: Its fixture is designed with characteristic of flexibility, and its leak proof structure is smart as well.
sentences.chinese: 其夹具带有柔性化设计，防漏结构也较为巧妙。

sentences.english: A somnambulist can happily combine sleep and exercise.
sentences.chinese: 梦游者能把睡眠和运动巧妙地结合在一起。

sentences.english: Well-operated investment distinguishes one from others between retiring in his 40's or his 60's.
sentences.chinese: 巧妙投资，你在不惑之年或花甲退休就会体会到区别。

sentences.english: Sing unto him a new song; play skilfully with a loud noise.
sentences.chinese: 应当向他唱新歌，弹得巧妙，声音洪亮。

sentences.english: The director cleverly atmosphered the film for added chills.
sentences.chinese: 导演手法巧妙地着意渲染使电影更增添恐怖气氛。

sentences.english: This was an ingenious piece of work combining mathematics and observation.
sentences.chinese: 这一发现巧妙地结合了数学和观察学。

sentences.english: he says, skillfully across the beat of the meter.
sentences.chinese: 他说在节奏的变换中巧妙地穿插。

sentences.english: People are always in skillfully varnished himself.
sentences.chinese: 人总是在巧妙地掩饰自己。

definition: exquisite/fine and delicate (usu. of works of art)
to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
to conform to no conventional pattern/unconventional/offbeat
lit. new bud/fig. new and original
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
having a unique or distinctive style
original and ingenious (idiom)/to show great creativity
variant of 別緻|别致[bie2 zhi4]
